title: Herbed New Potatoes with Pancetta
introduction: Savor the flavors of tender new potatoes infused with aromatic herbs and delectable pancetta. This dish brings out the full potential of freshly dug potatoes, making them an irresistible addition to any meal. If new potatoes are not available, an all-purpose potato will work just as well.
ingredients: 6 fresh basil leaves, torn into bits
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Scrub the potatoes with a brush under cold running water. Peel them if desired. Cut the potatoes into 1-inch pieces.
Combine the pancetta, onion, and olive oil in a large skillet. Cook over medium heat until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the potatoes and cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes.

Stir in the garlic, basil, rosemary, bay leaf, and salt and pepper to taste. Cover the pan and cook for 20 minutes more, stirring occasionally, until the potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork. Add a little water if the potatoes begin to brown too rapidly.
Remove the bay leaf and serve hot.
